titles.title: Liveable Wage Act of 1997
To amend the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to increase the minimum wage and to provide for an increase in such wage based on the cost of living.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and the Workforce.

bill.summary: 7/28/1997--Introduced. Liveable Wage Act of 1997 - Amends the Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 to: (1) increase the minimum wage to $6.50 an hour, beginning after December 30, 1997 (sic); and (2) provide that the minimum wage rate shall be increased by indexing to the cost of living, in the same manner as benefits are indexed under the Social Security Act, for calendar 1999 and thereafter.
